This statistic displays the share of single-use plastic packaging in the food sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of March 2019 . During the survey period , 44 percent of the respondents stated that they used at least one type of single-use plastic packaging to store food . The majority of food packaging is made of plastic due to its properties , including being lightweight and being able to be recycled . However, single-use plastic items such as plastic cutlery , cups , straws and stirrers are often not recycled . The United Kingdom is one of the world's largest consumers of plastic , with the UK government recently announcing a ban on the manufacture of plastic straws , and the government is currently consulting on banning the use of plastic stirrers .
The single-use plastic items which were most frequently used by the respondents were plastic cutlery ( 69 percent ) and plastic bags for packaging food ( 37 percent ) . Other common types of single-use plastic used in the food sector include plastic bottle lids , plastic cups and plastic tubs .
